decks.notes: The main focus of this Ruby Storm deck is to generate mana quickly and efficiently using cards like Pyretic Ritual and Ruby Medallion, then chain together spells to create a massive storm count. This allows the player to cast powerful spells like Grapeshot or Past in Flames multiple times in a single turn, overwhelming their opponent with a flurry of spells. The deck also includes cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Wish to provide additional versatility and ways to win the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combo strategy without the need for traditional lands. By efficiently disrupting opponents' plays with counterspells like Spell Snare and Disrupting Shoal, while also controlling the field through cards like Suppression Ray and Whir of Invention, it aims to build up resources with cards like Lotus Bloom and Thundertrap Trainer before ultimately using Goblin Charbelcher to deal massive damage to the opponent. The key is to carefully manage resources and timing to set up the win condition without relying on traditional land cards.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays using a combination of powerful creatures like Territorial Kavu, Ragavan, and Scion of Draco, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding to control the board and protect its creatures. Additionally, it includes a diverse mana base to ensure consistent casting of spells. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early pressure and efficient removal spells to secure a fast victory.

The deck focuses on quick and aggressive creature-based gameplay, utilizing cards like Ajani, Guide of Souls, and Ragavan to put early pressure on the opponent. It also includes removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to clear the way for attacks. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Static Prison and Seasoned Pyromancer while maintaining a steady stream of threats to overwhelm the opponent. The sideboard may include additional removal or disruption cards to adapt to different matchups. Overall, the strategy revolves around maintaining a strong board presence and finishing the opponent quickly.

The key idea of this deck is to cycle through your cards with cards like Street Wraith and Shardless Agent to fill your graveyard with creatures. Once you have enough creatures in your graveyard, you can cast Living End to bring all those creatures back onto the battlefield, while your opponent likely has no creatures in play. This allows you to overwhelm your opponent with a sudden surge of creatures and potentially win the game in one big swing, taking advantage of the synergy between cycling cards and the Living End spell.
